messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: BOSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION DEPARTMENT
Environmental Crimes Unit
SIGNAL: 91E
ITEM NUMBER: E-91072-29
PAGE 32 of 72
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Samuel Peterson
Sgt. Rachel Adams
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Margaret Clark
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Derek Brown
Sgt. Laura Wilson
( Wildlife Protection Unit)
Det. Anthony Miller
Det. Rebecca Scott
( Wildlife Protection Unit)
Det. Eric Johnson
( Wildlife Protection Unit)
Det. Heather Lewis
Det. Brandon Taylor
(General Assignment)
Det. Lisa Morgan
(Environmental Analysis Unit)
Det. James Robinson
(Water Quality Unit)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, park ranger.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
22 APRIL 2029 at around 3:00 PM in the Franklin Park area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Margaret Clark
4976
In the midst of the investigation, complex ecological evidence and conflicting ranger reports posed significant challenges. Officer Mitchell, patrolling Franklin Park, was the first to respond to the environmental incident. He was aided by Sgt. Derek Brown and Patrol Officer Simmons, who secured the park area. Technician Harris, specializing in ecological forensics, was brought in to assess the impact. Criminalist Allen, thoroughly examining the environmental samples, identified pollutants that were crucial in tracing the source. Coroner Dr. Martinez was consulted to examine a wildlife casualty, which unexpectedly provided key leads to the environmental crime. Patrol Officer Gomez, interacting with park visitors, collected observations that were essential in piecing together the events leading to the incident.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Samuel Peterson Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Environmental Crimes Unit. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Rachel Adams Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Peterson. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Margaret Clark Officer Context: Lead investigator of the environmental crime case, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Derek Brown Officer Context: Assisted at the scene, part of the Wildlife Protection Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Laura Wilson Officer Context: Wildlife Protection Unit sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Anthony Miller Officer Context: Wildlife Protection Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Rebecca Scott Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Wildlife Protection Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Eric Johnson Officer Context: Wildlife Protection Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Heather Lewis Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Brandon Taylor Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the environmental crime case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Lisa Morgan Officer Context: Environmental Analysis Unit detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. James Robinson Officer Context: Water Quality Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Mitchell Officer Context: First responder to the environmental incident in Franklin Park. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Simmons Officer Context: Assisted in securing the park area. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Harris Officer Context: Specialized in ecological forensics, assessed environmental impact. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Allen Officer Context: Examined environmental samples, identified pollutants linked to the source. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Martinez Officer Context: Examined a wildlife casualty, provided leads to the environmental crime. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Gomez Officer Context: Collected observations from park visitors, aiding the investigation. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
